definition: to rely on/to be dependent on
to depend on/to hang on in a place/bad/to renege (on promise)/to disclaim/to rat (on debts)/rascally/to blame/to put the blame on

sentences.english: It is better to take refuge in the Lord than to trust in princes.
sentences.chinese: 投靠耶和華，強似倚賴王子。

sentences.english: Retailers depend on local government for a licence and a place to operate.
sentences.chinese: 零售商們倚賴當地政府給予營業執照和場所去運營。

sentences.english: The quality of the Proseminar will heavily depend on your full involvement and commitment to class participation.
sentences.chinese: 研討會的品質將倚賴您們對課程的全力參與及承諾。

sentences.english: Secondly the thesis explored the stable and harmonious economic order on which Shanxi merchants relied to develop.
sentences.chinese: 其次探索了晉商發展所倚賴的穩定和諧的經濟秩序。

sentences.english: The fact is, Hong Kong is very much an externally-oriented economy.
sentences.chinese: 事實上，香港經濟主要倚賴對外貿易。

sentences.english: It is better to trust in the LORD than to put confidence in princes.
sentences.chinese: 投靠耶和華，強似倚賴王子。

sentences.english: Whorf proposed first that all higher levels of thinking are dependent on language.
sentences.chinese: 沃爾夫首先提出，所有高層次的思維都倚賴於語言。

sentences.english: It is better to take refuge in the Lord than to trust in man.
sentences.chinese: 投靠耶和華，強似倚賴人。

sentences.english: But you couldn't have amassed the money you did just being mechanical, could you?
sentences.chinese: 你不能僅只倚賴機械系統掙錢，是嗎？

definition: ability to make one's own decisions
to avoid the important and dwell on the trivial/to keep silent about major charges while admitting minor ones
to turn a blind eye to
to misjudge/error of judgment/incorrect ruling/miscarriage of justice
to put forward plans and ideas (also derogatory)/to give advice (idiom)
